Joseph is representing less than one percent of U.S. High School seniors.

We'd also like to congratulate Riverside High School senior George Harris for also receiving recognition in the 20201 National Merit Scholarship Program!

She earned her administrative certificate through Notre Dame College.

Mrs. Wakim is looking forward to her new role as principal of Melridge Elementary working with students, families, and staff.

Around 6:50 a.m. on Tuesday, June 2, an individual was able to hack into an employee’s account.

This individual was able to create new passwords and make changes to the District’s website, as well as send out messages to students and parents through Infinite Campus.

The District is taking this incident very seriously, and we have been obtaining additional information from our IT Department, eSchoolView (our website management company) and the Lake Geauga Computer Association – who oversees Infinite Campus.

Our internal investigation does not indicate this individual obtained any personal or credit card/bank account information via Infinite Campus. Credit card information is not stored or saved in Infinite Campus. In addition, it does not appear any other personal information was altered in Infinite Campus.

The incident has been turned over to the Lake County Sheriff’s Office, and they will conduct a thorough investigation. Threats or other activity designed to disrupt the educational environment could lead to criminal charges and/or school discipline.

The Riverside Local School District and the Educational Service Center of the Western Reserve have agreed to terms on the entire Hale Road Elementary property, located at 56 Hale Road in Painesville Township.

The Educational Service Center of the Western Reserve agrees to pay the Riverside Local School District a total of $110,000 over the span of the next three years.

Hale Road Elementary was among four schools that the Riverside Local School District closed at the end of the 2018-2019 school year. In September of 2019, the District opened up Parkside and Riverview elementary schools as a result of the passage of a 2016 Bond Levy.

In December, the District agreed to sell the back portion of Hadden Elementary to Painesville Township. The District will continue to do its due diligence on the decommissioning of the front portion of Hadden Elementary as well as the Leroy Elementary property.

The Educational Service Center of the Western Reserve plans to operate unique programs and services at Hale Road to support school districts and students across Lake County and beyond.

Best of luck to all our swimmers and divers who will be competing in the District Tournament at Cleveland State University starting tomorrow.

Trent Babcock, Ella Steen and Natasha Zahursky (divers) will compete tomorrow.

Sammi Smith, Jenna Leonard, Grace Klein, Lauren Shambaugh, Kylie Lanning, Maya Jeras and Mason Steen (swimmers) will compete on Friday.

In addition, Riverside High School freshman Julia Hixson will compete in the inaugural para-swimming event on Friday. The OHSAA has added two para-swimming events to the District Tournament and intends to bring the para-swimming events to the state tournament in 2021.

Julia was born without a hip socket or femur bone and had her right foot amputated at age 4. She has been swimming competitively for years – competing at both the high school and club levels.

Congratulations to Riverside High School senior Logan Bell for being selected as a finalist in the 2020 National Merit Scholarship Program and receiving a Certificate of Merit.

Logan is one of approximately 15,000 finalists in the program. More than 1.6 million students from 22,000 high schools across the country were entered into the National Merit Scholarship Program by taking the 2018 Preliminary SAT/National Merit Scholarship Qualifying Test.

Logan is representing less than one percent of U.S. High School seniors.

This marks the second straight year Riverside High School has had a finalist in the National Merit Scholarship Program, following Zachary Leopold’s selection in 2019.

At last night's Board of Education Meeting, the Board recognized Laura Augustine, Dr. Christopher Basich and Richard Schmidt for being selected by the Ohio Department of Education as Ohio Teacher Leader Liaisons!

Only 50 teachers total in the state of Ohio were selected!

As an Ohio Teacher Leader Liaison, they will gain knowledge and skills related to trust-building, communications, feedback and use of data as well as acquiring understanding of state government roles and processes related to education.

The teachers that were selected will work collaboratively with the Ohio Department of Education, engage in two-way communications and feedback about current and future education topics related to Each Child, Our Future: Ohio’s Strategic Plan for Education.

Congratulations!

Homeschooled children can also receive the voucher to attend any designated EdChoice… More

The District is hosting a Senior Citizen Appreciation Dinner on Thursday, November 21 at 4 p.m.

Resident seniors can enjoy dinner in the Riverside High School cafeteria prepared and served by students in the Foods and Nutrition classes. The dinner will then be followed by a free performance of the fall play, Radium Girls by the Drama Club in the auditorium.

The appreciation night is FREE for senior citizens.

The general public can purchase tickets to the play on Thursday, November 21 at 5 p.m., Friday, November 22 at 7:30 p.m. and Saturday, November 23 at 7:30 p.m. Tickets for the shows are $8 for students and $10 for adults. Tickets can be purchased in the link below:

https://rivtheatre.booktix.com/

Riverside High School is inviting Veterans of our armed forces to attend its annual Veterans Day Tribute & Luncheon on Monday, November 11 at 11 a.m.

Veterans will be welcomed to the high school Auditorium to experience a tribute video, letters of gratitude from students and staff, band and choir performances and more. Lunch will also be provided.

Please contact Jenny Cavell at Jenny.Cavell@riversideschools.net or leave a voicemail at 440.352.3341 ext. 7070 to RSVP.
